block.p: Elizabeth Lindsay Padin, a daughter of Christina B. Padin and Edward R. Padin of New Rochelle, N.Y., was married yesterday to Ensign Gregory Barton Storer, a son of Teresa B. Storer and George B. Storer III of Branford, Conn. The Rev. Robert Henry performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Augustine in Larchmont, N.Y.
Mrs. Storer, 25, until last month was a media strategist at TargetCast TCM, a media planning and buying agency in New York. She graduated from Hamilton College.

Elizabeth Lindsay Padin, a daughter of Christina B. Padin and Edward R. Padin of New Rochelle, N.Y., was married yesterday to Ensign Gregory Barton Storer, a son of Teresa B. Storer and George B. Storer III of Branford, Conn. The Rev. Robert Henry performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Augustine in Larchmont, N.Y.

Elizabeth Lindsay Padin, a daughter of Christina B. Padin and Edward R. Padin of New Rochelle, N.Y., was married yesterday to Ensign Gregory Barton Storer, a son of Teresa B. Storer and George B. Storer III of Branford, Conn. The Rev. Robert Henry performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Augustine in Larchmont, N.Y.
Mrs. Storer, 25, until last month was a media strategist at TargetCast TCM, a media planning and buying agency in New York. She graduated from Hamilton College.

Her father is the general manager of Doubledown Media, a New York publisher of magazines, including Trader Monthly, Dealmaker and Private Air. Her mother is a buyer and the display manager at Wendy Gee, a store selling furniture and home accessories in Larchmont.
Ensign Storer, 22, is a trainee in the Naval Submarine School in Groton, Conn. He graduated from the United States Naval Academy.
His mother manages her family's real estate investments. His father is the vice president for operations at the Connecticut Bank and Trust Company in Hartford.
